definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
erhua variant of 小兩口|小两口[xiao3 liang3 kou3]

sentences.english: We think every young couple should set up a home of their own.
sentences.chinese: 我们提倡所有的小两口都能靠自己的双手构建家园。

sentences.english: The happy twosome , who got hitched have been traveling in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 这对刚结婚的快乐小两口一直在欧洲旅游。

sentences.english: The pragmatic bride-to-be initially planned to rent a gown.
sentences.chinese: 务实的小两口原本打算是去租一套礼服的。

sentences.english: Yet for all that, occasionally they also will have a storm in a teacup.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，小两口偶然也会有小风波的。

sentences.english: The couple now go on their honeymoon which can last several days or weeks.
sentences.chinese: 然后小两口儿去度蜜月，蜜月通常为几天或几周。

sentences.english: And then the couple goes on their honeymoon.
sentences.chinese: 然后小两口儿就去度蜜月了。

definition: erhua variant of 小兩口|小两口[xiao3 liang3 kou3]
world with only two people (usually refers to a romantic couple)/romantic couple's world
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
